CFSTRenD 0.9.0

    Plot and Export Tree Ring Growth Mapping Outputs

    plot_mapping3.Rd

    This function interpolates and visualizes tree ring data (e.g., BAI growth change) across space and time using inverse distance weighting (IDW). Outputs can include maps in PNG and GIF formats, interpolated raster files in GeoTIFF format, and gridded values in CSV format.

    plot_mapping3(
  data,
  year.span = c(1801, 2017),
  extent.lim = NULL,
  grid.step = 0.1,
  animation_fps = 1,
  by.spc = FALSE,
  parms.out = c("", "csv", "tif", "png", "gif"),
  dir.out = NULL,
  data.crs = "+proj=longlat +datum=WGS84 +no_defs",
  ...
)

    Arguments

    data

    A data.table object of class cfs_mapping, typically generated by read_series.

    year.span

    A numeric vector of length two specifying the start and end years for analysis. Default is c(1801, 2017).

    extent.lim

    Optional. A numeric vector specifying map extent in the form c(xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax). If NULL, extent is computed from the data.

    grid.step

    A numeric value specifying the resolution (in degrees) of the interpolation grid. Default is 0.1.

    animation_fps

    Frames per second for the animated GIF output. Default is 1.0.

    by.spc

    Logical. If TRUE, runs separately for each species. Default is FALSE.

    parms.out

    Character vector specifying the types of outputs to generate. Valid values are: "csv", "tif", "png", and "gif".

    dir.out

    A character string specifying the directory where outputs will be saved. Required if parms.out is not empty.

    data.crs

    Character string specifying the CRS (coordinate reference system) for spatial outputs. Default is WGS84.

    ...

    Additional parameters passed to the function.

    Value

    This function does not return a value but saves outputs to disk depending on the options selected in parms.out. Output includes:

    • PNG maps of interpolated tree growth

    • Animated GIFs showing change over time

    • Raster GeoTIFFs of interpolated values

    • CSV files of gridded predicted values

    Details

    The function performs spatial interpolation using IDW and masks outputs to Canada and boreal zones using shapefiles. The elevation layer and mask files are internal to the CFSTRenD package and used for contextual mapping.

    PNG and GIF outputs are generated using magick, raster outputs via terra, and interpolation via gstat.

    Examples

    if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
dt <- read_series(list.files("data/input", full.names = TRUE))
plot_mapping(dt, year.span = c(1900, 2000), by.spc = TRUE,
             parms.out = c("png", "gif", "csv"),
             dir.out = "outputs/maps/")
} # }
